name: 1.1 Submission & approval of concrete mix design prior to commencement of project
FREQUENCY: Prior to first concrete pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete mix design submitted and approved at least 2 weeks prior to first pour.
○ Concrete shall be manufactured, transported and handled in accordance with the requirements of AS 3600, AS3600 & AS 1379
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: DN S002 P&S IFC
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Mix Design ITP
1.2 Submission & approval of epoxy adhesive product prior to commencement of project
FREQUENCY: Prior to first epoxy pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure product adheres to notes specified in the P&S DRG S004
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: DN S004 P&S IFC
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent approval, Completed ITP
1.2 Submission & approval of high-strength non-shrink mortar prior to commencement of project
FREQUENCY: Prior to first grout pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure product adheres to notes specified in the P&S DRG S005
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: DN S005 P&S IFC
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent approval, Completed ITP
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— using the correct and complete set of drawings
— all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PMP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PMP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to the first concrete pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete Mix is Registered with VicRoads. Concrete mix meets strength, grade, and maximum aggregate size as detailed on drawings.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforcement schedule has been prepared for the reinforcement supply, to ensure that it achieves the specified tolerances on member dimensions, concrete cover and specified locations
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Demolition shall be to the depths shown on the drawings and that necessary to provide satisfactory foundation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Constructed in such a manner so it can be removed without damage to the concrete. Formwork/shoring shall be placed in locations where steel reinforcement and other fixtures can be inspected, and sufficiently tight at joints to prevent loss of slurry
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Designed and constructed in such a manner so it can be removed without damage to the concrete.
○ Formwork to be rigid, watertight, braced, tied together & selected to achieve the required surface finish.
○ Formwork shall not be placed where steel & fixtures cannot be inspected.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The correct reinforcement grade, quantity, size, orientation, location and spacing as shown on the structural drawings.
○ Projecting reinforcement is the correct length and location.
○ Splice lengths achieve the minimum length and are in contact for this length.
○ The reinforcement surface condition is free from dirt, debris and damage.
○ The resulting cage securely held with sufficient ties to limit displacement or deformation during the concrete pour.
○ Minimum cover as shown on the structural drawings for each face has been achieved (including tie wire locations).
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall not be place when temperature is <5°C or > 35°C
○ All steel components that are in contact with the concrete shall be cooled to below 32°C before concrete is placed
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Evidence that the forms, reinforcement, electrical continuity and other cast-in items conforming to the requirements of this specification and the drawings has been reviewed by the Nominated Authority
○ All foreign material has been completely removed from the forms.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Pre Pour checklist completed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sampling in accordance with 610.16
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Discharge time (concrete placed and compacted) < 60 minutes from batch time unless approved otherwise.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed. Accurate Site Notes & Load Mapping
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall be tansported, handled and placed in a manner that will prevent segregation or loss of materials
○ Concrete shall not be moved horizontally by vibrators
○ In continuous pours the max. time lag between truckloads on site is 25 minutes
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sufficient time shall be given for the concrete to cure prior to loading.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork shall be removed carefully and in such a manner as to avoid damage to the member or the concrete surfaces and maintain safety at all stages of removal. Formwork and formwork supports shall not be disturbed or adjusted during the concreting operation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
5.3 Positional tolerance and dimensions of concrete members and piles
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Dimensions within the tolerances given in Cl 17.5 of AS3600 (-10,+40)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Post Pour Checklist completed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete sampled and tested for Compressive Strength, and Slump.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Recorded of as-built drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— using the correct and complete set of drawings
— all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PMP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Dimensions in plan as per drawings to achieve the desired grout profile.
○ Formwork rigid, sufficiently braced to support the pressure of the product and sealed to prevent leaks.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete substrate surface moisture condition as per the Product's TDS, with no ponding of water.
○ Where applicable, any reinforcement is clean and has the required cover.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings, Fosroc Conbextra EP65 Plus TDS 610.20
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Grouting may be carried out without conditioning at ambient temperatures between, 5°C to 25°C. Pot life will be reduced when temperature exceeds 20°C.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Fosroc Conbextra EP65 Plus TDS
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Size of mixer should match the application.
○ Only whole bags to be mixed with potable water.
○ Volume of water matches the required amount for flowable consistency and accurately measured.
○ Product poured into the mixer slowly.
○ Mixing time as per TDS so that a smooth, even consistency is obtained.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Fosroc Conbextra EP65 Plus TDS 610.28
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cube moulds to be 75mm x 75mm maximum, made from rigid steel moulds.
○ Testing is be in accordance with the following frequencies:
— First batch = 3 cubes (2 no. 7 day strength, 1 no. 28 day strength)
— Every 100kg of product thereafter = 3 cubes (2 no. 7 day strength, 1 no. 28 day strength)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All batches are traceable.
○ Product poured from one side of the formwork to eliminate the entrapment of air or surplus pre-soaking water.
○ Product should flow to all areas and self consolidate.
○ Product that stiffens or is showing signs of stiffening shall not be used.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed. Accurate Site Notes & Load Mapping
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Curing to commence immediately after finishing operations. Epoxy shall not be distrubed while curing occurs.
○ Curing methodology to be in accordance with the approved procedure and manufacturer's TDS.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Grout sampled and tested for Compressive Strength.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings, Product TDS 610.28, 610.33
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Recorded of as-built drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
